intro: Sarcolobus carinatus, commonly known as the horned wort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features a stout, branching stem with leaves that are pinnately divided and often have a distinctive ridge or carina. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Sarcolobus carinatus is typically found in moist, calcareous soils and is often used in traditional herbal medicine.
